intro: Acmella tenella, commonly known as the zigzag coralplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its unique, zigzag-shaped stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Acmella tenella is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking visual appeal and adaptability to various growing conditions.
